poem:
**Extreme Disappointment**

In the circuit's whisper, a distant murmur,  
China's sigh travels over silicon rivers  
to the land where tulips bloom  
under starlit windmills.  
A minister, a morning coffee,  
a word misfired—a wake-up call.  
Chips sketched in whispers,  
nation by nation, drawn  
in lines of disappointment  
carved by trade's quiet hand.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China voices ‘extreme disappointment’ with Dutch minister at centre of car chip row The Chinese government has expressed “extreme disappointment” with the Dutch minister at the heart of a row over chip supply to the car industry. A spokesperson for the ministry of commerce was responding to an interview by Vincent Karremans on Thursday in which he described the standoff between China and the European Union as a “wake-up call” for western leaders. The spokesperson". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
